headline:
Unilever has a taste of success in Vietnam: FOOD INDUSTRY: The fish sauce made
in Phu Quoc is prized above all others. By selling it under its Knorr brand, the
Anglo-Dutch group is hoping to win the loyalty of local customers, writes Amy
Kazmin
Art imitates life at Unilever OBSERVER

Summer leaves Unilever cold: Cool weather contributes to poor sales: * Group
also blames tough European trading conditions and greater competition in India

The group's figurehead Niall FitzGerald retires next month and a five-year
restructuring is nearly completed. But as the era ends its successes are being
diluted by stock market scepticism over weak sales and a slow response to market
trends, writes Adam Jones No nimble giant: the stumbling blocks Unilever faces
on its path to growth
